title: Getting started
text: diffeRenTES small package written R focuses primarily computation tree-like structure describing cell differentiation process following mathematical model firstly described work (Villani, Barbieri, Serra 2011).

title: Getting started
text: install latest development version diffeRenTES directly GitHub use:

title: Getting started
text: example purposes random Boolean network using BoolNet R package generated. real world application Boolean network can generated loaded (e.g., using loadNetwork method BoolNet package), long stored object class BooleanNetwork. , Threshold Ergodic Sets (TESs) computed, , remember, represent different cell types model. Lastly, following code saves image computed differentiation tree file system. resulting differentiation tree presented. reports various TESs attractors composed differentiation process emerging reduction intra-cellular noise, synthesized thresholds present direct arcs.
code: library(diffeRenTES) library(BoolNet) net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)   # Attractors Transition Matrix computation ATM <- getATM(net, attractors, MAX_STEPS_TO_FIND_ATTRACTORS = 100)   # ATM structure in matrix format. # a1, a2, etc. refer to the attractors found. print(ATM$ATM) #>      a1  a2   a3  a4   a5   a6 #> a1 0.30 0.0 0.00 0.1 0.00 0.60 #> a2 0.10 0.4 0.10 0.0 0.00 0.40 #> a3 0.10 0.1 0.40 0.0 0.00 0.40 #> a4 0.10 0.0 0.00 0.3 0.00 0.60 #> a5 0.15 0.0 0.00 0.0 0.45 0.40 #> a6 0.13 0.0 0.03 0.0 0.00 0.83  # No. perturbations that have not reach another attractor within the provided MAX_STEPS_TO_FIND_ATTRACTORS print(ATM$lostFLips) #> [1] 0 #TESs computation TESs <- getTESs(ATM)   #Retrieve the computed TESs print(TESs$TES) #> $level_0 #> $level_0$TES_1 #> [1] "a1" "a2" "a3" "a4" "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_1 #> $level_1$TES_2 #> [1] "a1" "a4" "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_2 #> $level_2$TES_3 #> [1] "a1" "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_3 #> $level_3$TES_4 #> [1] "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_4 #> $level_4$TES_5 #> [1] "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_5 #> $level_5$TES_6 #> [1] "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_6 #> $level_6$TES_7 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $level_6$TES_8 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $level_6$TES_9 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $level_6$TES_10 #> [1] "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_7 #> $level_7$TES_11 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $level_7$TES_12 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $level_7$TES_13 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $level_7$TES_14 #> [1] "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_8 #> $level_8$TES_15 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $level_8$TES_16 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $level_8$TES_17 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $level_8$TES_18 #> [1] "a4" #>  #> $level_8$TES_19 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $level_8$TES_20 #> [1] "a6" #>  #>  #> $level_9 #> $level_9$TES_21 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $level_9$TES_22 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $level_9$TES_23 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $level_9$TES_24 #> [1] "a4" #>  #> $level_9$TES_25 #> [1] "a5" #>  #> $level_9$TES_26 #> [1] "a6"  #And the noise thresholds at which they emerge. print(TESs$thresholds) #>  [1] 0.00 0.03 0.10 0.13 0.15 0.30 0.40 0.45 0.60 0.83 # Saving the TES-based differentiation tree into a file saveDifferentiationTreeToFile(TESs, "exampleTree")

title: Getting started
text: Villani, Marco, Alessia Barbieri, Roberto Serra. 2011. “Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation.” PLOS ONE 6 (3): 1–9. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0017703.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Michele Braccini. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Braccini M (2022). diffeRenTES: Computation Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process (Synchronous) Boolean Networks. R package version 0.3.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {diffeRenTES: Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous) Boolean Networks},   author = {Michele Braccini},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.3.1}, }

title:
Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold
    Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous)
    Boolean Networks
text: diffeRenTES (French various, different) package written R , starting Boolean networks BoolNet package, computes ATM (Attractor Transition Matrix) structure tree-like structure, based TES concept, describing cell differentiation process. TESs (Threshold Ergodic Sets) mathematical abstractions represent different cell types arising ontogenesis. TESs powerful model biological differentiation based Boolean networks belongs firstly described “Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation” Villani M, Barbieri , Serra R (2011) Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation. PLOS ONE 6 (3): e17703. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0017703

title:
Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold
    Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous)
    Boolean Networks
text: package requires following R libraries: BoolNet igraph DOT

title:
Computation of Attractor Transition Matrix (ATM) and Threshold
    Ergodic Set-Based Cell Differentiation Process from (Synchronous)
    Boolean Networks
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2)     attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net)      ATM <- getATM(net, attractors) # attractors transition matrix computation     TESs <- getTESs(ATM) #TESs computation     saveDifferentiationTreeToFile(TESs, "exampleTree") #saving the TES-based differentiation tree into a file

title: Compute ATM — getATM
text: getATM returns ATM (Attractor Transition Matrix) structure. ATM computes probability transition attractors Boolean network upon introduction noise form logic negation node state attractor,  checking attractor dynamics relaxes. diagonal ATM accounts attractor robustness, diagonal values represent probability returning attractor perturbation.

title: Compute ATM — getATM
text: net Boolean network previously loaded loadNetwork() BoolNet package synchronous_attractors Synchronous attractors Boolean network MAX_STEPS_TO_FIND_ATTRACTORS Number steps dynamics perturbation gives

title: Compute ATM — getATM
text: output named list containing computed ATM structure, number lost flips (.e., number perturbations reach another attractor within provided MAX_STEPS_TO_FIND_ATTRACTORS), lastly attractors two formats: one returned BoolNet package (called decimal) binary translation (called binary).

title: Compute ATM — getATM
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net) getATM(net, attractors) #> $ATM #>     a1  a2 #> a1 1.0 0.0 #> a2 0.5 0.5 #>  #> $lostFLips #> [1] 0 #>  #> $attractors #> $attractors$decimal #> $attractors$decimal$a1 #> $attractors$decimal$a1$involvedStates #>      [,1] #> [1,]  362 #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a1$basinSize #> [1] 960 #>  #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a2 #> $attractors$decimal$a2$involvedStates #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] #> [1,]  775  923  839  795 #>  #> $attractors$decimal$a2$basinSize #> [1] 64 #>  #>  #>  #> $attractors$binary #> $attractors$binary$a1 #>        [,1] #> Gene1     0 #> Gene2     1 #> Gene3     0 #> Gene4     1 #> Gene5     0 #> Gene6     1 #> Gene7     1 #> Gene8     0 #> Gene9     1 #> Gene10    0 #>  #> $attractors$binary$a2 #>        [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] #> Gene1     1    1    1    1 #> Gene2     1    1    1    1 #> Gene3     1    0    1    0 #> Gene4     0    1    0    1 #> Gene5     0    1    0    1 #> Gene6     0    0    0    0 #> Gene7     0    0    1    0 #> Gene8     0    1    0    0 #> Gene9     1    1    1    1 #> Gene10    1    1    1    1 #>  #>  #>

title: Compute TES — getTESs
text: Creates structure constructing TES described "Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation Villani M, Barbieri , Serra R (2011) Dynamical Model Genetic Networks Cell Differentiation. PLOS ONE 6(3): e17703. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0017703"

title: Compute TES — getTESs
text: ATM ATM structure returned getATM method

title: Compute TES — getTESs
text: output named list contains list computed TESs, noise thresholds emerged lastly ATM structure.

title: Compute TES — getTESs
code: net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net) ATM <- getATM(net, attractors) getTESs(ATM) #> $TES #> $TES$level_0 #> $TES$level_0$TES_1 #> [1] "a1" "a2" "a3" "a4" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_1 #> $TES$level_1$TES_2 #> [1] "a2" "a3" "a4" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_2 #> $TES$level_2$TES_3 #> [1] "a3" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_3 #> $TES$level_3$TES_4 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_3$TES_5 #> [1] "a4" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_4 #> $TES$level_4$TES_6 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_7 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_4$TES_8 #> [1] "a4" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_5 #> $TES$level_5$TES_9 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_10 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_11 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_5$TES_12 #> [1] "a4" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_6 #> $TES$level_6$TES_13 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_14 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_15 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_6$TES_16 #> [1] "a4" #>  #>  #> $TES$level_7 #> $TES$level_7$TES_17 #> [1] "a1" #>  #> $TES$level_7$TES_18 #> [1] "a2" #>  #> $TES$level_7$TES_19 #> [1] "a3" #>  #> $TES$level_7$TES_20 #> [1] "a4" #>  #>  #>  #> $thresholds #> [1] 0.00 0.03 0.10 0.30 0.40 0.50 0.67 0.80 #>  #> $ATM #> $ATM$ATM #>      a1  a2  a3   a4 #> a1 0.30 0.0 0.3 0.40 #> a2 0.00 0.5 0.5 0.00 #> a3 0.00 0.1 0.8 0.10 #> a4 0.03 0.0 0.3 0.67 #>  #> $ATM$lostFLips #> [1] 0 #>  #> $ATM$attractors #> $ATM$attractors$decimal #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a1 #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a1$involvedStates #>      [,1] #> [1,]  875 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a1$basinSize #> [1] 8 #>  #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a2 #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a2$involvedStates #>      [,1] [,2] #> [1,]   32   40 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a2$basinSize #> [1] 48 #>  #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a3 #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a3$involvedStates #>      [,1] [,2] #> [1,]   33   41 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a3$basinSize #> [1] 848 #>  #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a4 #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a4$involvedStates #>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] [,6] #> [1,]  297  353  363  891  809  369 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$decimal$a4$basinSize #> [1] 120 #>  #>  #>  #> $ATM$attractors$binary #> $ATM$attractors$binary$a1 #>        [,1] #> Gene1     1 #> Gene2     1 #> Gene3     0 #> Gene4     1 #> Gene5     0 #> Gene6     1 #> Gene7     1 #> Gene8     0 #> Gene9     1 #> Gene10    1 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$binary$a2 #>        [,1] [,2] #> Gene1     0    0 #> Gene2     0    0 #> Gene3     0    0 #> Gene4     0    1 #> Gene5     0    0 #> Gene6     1    1 #> Gene7     0    0 #> Gene8     0    0 #> Gene9     0    0 #> Gene10    0    0 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$binary$a3 #>        [,1] [,2] #> Gene1     1    1 #> Gene2     0    0 #> Gene3     0    0 #> Gene4     0    1 #> Gene5     0    0 #> Gene6     1    1 #> Gene7     0    0 #> Gene8     0    0 #> Gene9     0    0 #> Gene10    0    0 #>  #> $ATM$attractors$binary$a4 #>        [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] [,6] #> Gene1     1    1    1    1    1    1 #> Gene2     0    0    1    1    0    0 #> Gene3     0    0    0    0    0    0 #> Gene4     1    0    1    1    1    0 #> Gene5     0    0    0    1    0    1 #> Gene6     1    1    1    1    1    1 #> Gene7     0    1    1    1    0    1 #> Gene8     0    0    0    0    0    0 #> Gene9     1    1    1    1    1    1 #> Gene10    0    0    0    1    1    0 #>  #>  #>  #>

what: Save the differentiation tree using the DOT syntax and, if needed, produce the related image. — saveDifferentiationTreeToFile
title: Save the differentiation tree using the DOT syntax and, if needed, produce the related image. — saveDifferentiationTreeToFile
text: saveDifferentiationTreeToFile saves DOT representation derived differentiation tree file.

title: Save the differentiation tree using the DOT syntax and, if needed, produce the related image. — saveDifferentiationTreeToFile
Save the differentiation tree using the DOT syntax and, if needed, produce the related image. — saveDifferentiationTreeToFile
text: TESs TES structure computed getTESs filename filename .gv file save_image Logical parameter indicating whether saveDotFileDifferentiationTree produce also image tree, .svg format.

title: Save the differentiation tree using the DOT syntax and, if needed, produce the related image. — saveDifferentiationTreeToFile
text: None

title: Save the differentiation tree using the DOT syntax and, if needed, produce the related image. — saveDifferentiationTreeToFile
code: if (FALSE) { net <- BoolNet::generateRandomNKNetwork(10, 2) attractors <- BoolNet::getAttractors(net) ATM <- getATM(net, attractors) TESs <- getTESs(ATM) saveDifferentiationTreeToFile(TESs, "exampleTree") }
